posts.post_content: Do I really have to spell this out for you? Fine. [Selective Memory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selective Memory), Maybe a few [Sage Owl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sage Owl ) -like cards, and treasure hunt if you need it. Then stack all of your Eldrazi and/or other gigantic creatures on top, then swing. Congrats, you just sacked all of your lands that you will most likely ever get in the future for 36+ mana worth of creatures (and that's just the Legendary 3 eldrazi). also, [Crucible of Worlds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crucible of Worlds) helps a little.

posts.post_content: Why can't you gents think about more then playing it in standard, I've been play testing it all week, with a proxy. Play him in a Legacy Reanimator, you'll be able to play him in the first two turns then you should be able to reanimate or directly cast anywhere between 2 and 4 other large creatures. My best cast with him was at the end of turn two I had out aside from him, Akroma, Angel of Wrath, Iona, Shield of Emeria, Sphinx of the Steel Wind and Thraximundar. Let your opponent deal with that, I'm sure he will have a ton of fun.

posts.post_content: [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinter Twin) with something to untap or [Renegade Doppleganger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Renegade Doppleganger), hit with both -> Top 12 Cards can be played for free... (or whatever the cost of the combo you just played was). Pretty reasonable to me! Especially if you do a [Treasure Hunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Treasure Hunt) first as was suggested to make sure you're not just grabbing lands. When 1/5 of your deck gets put into play for free... on a single turn... unless you're really unlucky you've got a couple of bombs out or a lot of burns!

Posted By: ww_boy6 (4/19/2010 1:09:55 AM)

posts.post_content:
step 1: play [hellcarver demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hellcarver demon), [rage nimbus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rage nimbus), and [bazaar trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bazaar trader)  
step 2: give opponent hellcarver demon  
step 3: use rage nimbus to force hellcarver demon to attack, watch opponent sacrifice all other permanents  
step 4: avoid dying to the 6 cards your opponent can play for free  
step 5: kill hellcarver demon with [heat ray](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=heat ray)  
step 6: win

Posted By: Uhhsam (4/16/2010 5:44:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't think that you guys see the potential of this card. Imagine a burn deck, or a deck with a bunch of fatties. In a burn deck, you could \*potentially\* get 6 burn spells, but you'd be more likely to get 3 or 4, depending on the deck. Still, there is 6 damage from this guy, and let's say you have 3 [Lighning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lighning Bolt) style cards. That's about 15 damage. Also, imagine getting a few Eldrazi. You get a couple of those annihilators out, and you can quickly level your opponents forces. You also don't HAVE to attack with this guy, just let him sit there once you get a few good creatures out.  
  
4/5
posts.html:

Still, there is 6 damage from this guy, and let's say you have 3 Lighning Bolt style cards. That's about 15 damage. Also, imagine getting a few Eldrazi. You get a couple of those annihilators out, and you can quickly level your opponents forces. You also don't HAVE to attack with this guy, just let him sit there once you get a few good creatures out.

4/5

posts.post_content: I drafted with him in the pre-release yesterday and he works amazingly. i was hesitant at first because i didn't like the idea of killing everything except him, but ive used him to get out Emrakul once, and Ulamog's crusher a number of times... with the exception of one time, every time ive gotten him out i've won and the one time i lost was because my friend unsummoned him after i lost all of my permanents and had one swamp. 5/5
